title: Reset your password
body: If you forgot your password, use the 'Forgot password' link on the sign-in page. You'll receive a reset email. If you don't receive it, check spam or verify your email address.

title: Enable two-factor authentication (2FA)
body: To enable 2FA, go to Settings → Security → Two-factor authentication. Use an authenticator app for time-based codes. Save recovery codes in a secure place.

title: Rotate API keys safely
body: Create a new API key, deploy it, and verify traffic. Then revoke the old key. Avoid downtime by overlapping keys during rollout.

title: Billing: update payment method
body: To update your card, open Billing → Payment methods. Add the new card first, set it as default, then remove the expired card.

title: Billing: download invoices
body: Invoices are available under Billing → Invoices. You can download PDF invoices for each billing cycle for expense reporting.

title: Rate limiting and retries
body: When you hit rate limits, you'll receive HTTP 429. Use exponential backoff with jitter, respect Retry-After headers, and cap retries to avoid thundering herds.

title: Webhook delivery troubleshooting
body: If webhooks fail, verify endpoint availability, SSL validity, and response codes. We retry failed deliveries with exponential backoff for 24 hours.

title: Search relevance: keyword vs semantic
body: Keyword search matches exact terms; semantic search matches meaning. Hybrid search combines both to handle typos, synonyms, and exact identifiers.

title: Vector search: choosing an embedding model
body: Pick an embedding model that matches your domain. Evaluate with a small labeled set and track recall, precision, and latency. Normalize text consistently.

title: Chunking strategy for RAG
body: Chunk documents by headings and keep overlap small. Too small loses context; too large hurts retrieval precision and increases token cost.

title: Metadata filtering in search
body: Use metadata fields like product, version, language, and access level to filter results before reranking. Filtering improves quality and reduces cost.

title: Index lifecycle basics
body: Use ILM to manage hot-warm-cold tiers and retention. For knowledge bases, keep recent content hot and archive old versions with metadata for recall.

title: Latency budgeting for AI search
body: Set a target p95 latency budget. Allocate time to retrieval, reranking, and generation. Start with retrieval under 100ms and reranking under 200ms where possible.

title: Hybrid fusion: Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF)
body: RRF combines ranked lists by adding 1/(k + rank). It is robust when score scales differ, making it ideal to fuse BM25 and vector kNN results.

title: Reranking with cross-encoders
body: Rerank top candidates using a cross-encoder that scores query-document pairs. This improves ordering when retrieval returns many near-duplicates.

title: Debugging retrieval with query sets
body: Create a query set with expected documents. Track regressions with metrics like NDCG and MRR and keep an error log of failure modes.

title: Handling synonyms in product search
body: Use synonym lists for domain terms (e.g., 'refund' and 'chargeback'). Combine synonyms with semantic vectors so both exact and meaning matches work.

title: Secure indexing of sensitive data
body: Avoid indexing secrets. Use redaction, field-level security, and access controls. Keep embeddings aligned with your security model.

title: Observability: correlate incidents with semantic search
body: Index incident summaries and runbooks. Use semantic search to find similar past incidents and suggested mitigations.

title: E-commerce: handling misspellings
body: Lexical matching can struggle with misspellings. Use fuzziness for keywords and vectors for semantic similarity; then rerank for best results.

title: Streaming ingestion for logs
body: Use a streaming pipeline to ingest logs and metrics. Apply consistent parsing, enrich with metadata, and store summaries for fast retrieval.

title: Data retention for vector indices
body: Vector indices can grow quickly. Consider retention policies, deduplication, and quantization. Filter older content or compress vectors if needed.

title: Choosing topK and candidate size
body: Start with topK=10 and candidate_size=100 for kNN. Increase candidates if recall is low; decrease if latency is too high.

title: Version-aware documentation search
body: Tag docs with version and filter by the user's installed version. This prevents retrieving outdated steps and reduces hallucinations.

title: When vector-only search fails
body: Vector search can miss exact identifiers like error codes. Always keep a lexical path for IDs, part numbers, and structured fields.

title: When BM25-only search fails
body: BM25 struggles with paraphrases and synonyms. Vectors help recover meaning when wording differs from the document text.

title: A/B testing relevance changes
body: Run A/B tests for ranking changes. Track click-through, zero-result rate, and time-to-first-click. Combine online metrics with offline judgments.

title: Creating labeled data cheaply
body: Start with 20–50 queries from support/search logs. Label 1–3 relevant docs per query. Use this small set to validate changes quickly.

title: Relevance monitoring in production
body: Log queries, retrieval results, and user feedback. Build dashboards for top failing queries and monitor drift as content changes.
